Ok good.  That means postgres is probably running just fine.
A configuration error seems likely.  Perhaps something like postgres wasn't setup when openerp was installed so openerp couldn't create it's database and now it's mad.
Try and find the error logs for openerp.  Hopefully it has a more specific error.
Here's another thought.  I think the default postgres might not allow local connections.  You should make sure that you can access it locally.  "$ psql"  Then "=$ SELECT NOW();" and Ctrl-D to exit.
Did it ask you for a password?  Or did you specify one on the command line with "--password"?
